Lithium (Li)

Description

Discovered by Johann August Arfvedson, Lithium is an alkali metal which was discovered from a mineral, which is uncommon compared to others in the same category. Lithium can be used to produce rechargeable batteries for electronic devices, and also for non-rechargeable batteries.

Atomic Diagram

Atomic Number

3

Atomic Mass

6.941

Melting point

180℃

Boiling Point

1347℃

Group

1

Period

2
